Articles.Content:
so, no Ore tanks?

should there be? 

ive just made a custom tank, and xenon tanks too, just wondering if anyone else has?

i dont think there should be. I would consider Ore as cargo and cargo has to be loaded in fixed compartments on airplanes to avoid shifting loads.

But that wouldnt be a very Kerbal thing to do, right? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-03T18:51:58Z" title="05/03/2015 06:51  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 3, 2015</time> by MalfunctionM1Ke**
I wish Squad would just make tanks modular. It'd solve a lot of problems.

Agreed, a stock version of the FS tank switching part module would be a great thing.

Not only would it reduce the amount of parts the game needs to load, it would reduce the number of parts certain vessels use, as well. Instead of spamming xenon tanks, you can re-purpose a FL-T400 or something like that. With the LV-N now using only Liquid Fuel, it would also neatly solve the whole "all rocket fuel tanks now have crap mass ratios when using LV-N, even when dumping out the Oxidizer" problem.

Edit: There's probably other things a stock fuel tank switching module could do, like custom fuel/ox ratios for spaceplane tanks or something like that.

Edit2: Now that we have wet wing parts stock, being able to switch those tanks around would be nice as well.
